Posts.Content: hezzy wrote: Lately, I feel that with my few questions I have been blowing up the board, but I had to ask another. This question may seem odd, or ignorant but it's been on my mind for week now and I have to ask.  I read somewhere that having ear drainage is a sign of brain mets.  Is this true?  My ear has been draining for weeks (im use to ear infections) but it seems different.  I plan on calling the ONC in the morning, but I haven't been able to sleep.   I tried looking it up again but couldnt find anything.  Has anyone ever heard anything like this? heather j Dx 7/2/2007, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, 16/17 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: ??? hezzy heatherpalmerton

Posts.Content: hezzy wrote: For about two weeks I noticed that on my left shoulder, armpit, and arm having been hurting.  The feeling is odd and ongoing.  I figured I wait till (last) Monday to talk to my ONC about it.  I already have bone mets and just a week before had a bone scan and nothing new (or this area) had shown up. On Sunday it seemed like I was getting shooting pains down my arm.  My arm started to fall asleep and the pain would leave than minutes later feeling would return along with pain. I called the ONC answering service and was told to go into ER. They checked my vitals and everything was fine, lab was fine, x-ray was fine, after a sonogram they ruled out blood clots.  The Dr wasn't sure what to do so she ended up giving me pain medication and telling me to follow up with my ONC.  On Monday my ONC ordered a mri but thinks its a muscle problem and I'm sleeping on it wrong.  Im on Herceptin and Tamoxifin now, and it is on the side I had a mastectomy however that was years ago so the ONC wasn't worried.  Has anyone gone through something like this?  I heather j Dx 7/2/2007, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, 16/17 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: still not sure hezzy bmdaley

Posts.Content: May 14, 2009 09:10AM hezzy wrote: there isn't any swelling its just pain and numbness at no time does it stop it's either one or the other thanks for thoughts and prayers
Posts.Title: still not sure hezzy bmdaley

Posts.Content: hezzy wrote: I'm on the same meds as usual and this has never been like this before I'm terrified. Im taking herceptin, zometa, faslodex (4wks) than daily Xeloda, Tykerb ... others are diphen/atrop, fentanyal patch, dexanethosome, lovenax. I have been on this for some time and wasn't having any issues.  Lately, my feet are past swollen !!!!! I have severe neurapathy (feet,hands) which in the feet I've become use too and never complain nothing (hands ugh!).  This morning I cut string out of shoes just to wear shoe.  I called the nurses asking what to do and no one knows.  Haven'theard back from ONC yet.   Someone told me my feet swelling up like the size of a balloon means the cancer is at its worst Ive never heard that before. Im terridied after hearing that nor do I have a clue how to get rid of swelling. ANY ADVICE ID GO NUTS FOR ANY ??? Has anyone ever heard of swollen feet being a sign of your fight being over with? What can I do? heather j Dx 7/2/2007, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, 16/17 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: swollen feet ..please read please hezzy chainsawz

Posts.Content: May 14, 2011 04:00PM hezzy wrote: Ive been fighting brain mets since Aug 10. .  I was taking Tykerb and Xeloda but recently was removed from Xeloda.due to another issue.  I really believe the Tykerb has made a difference.  I went threw 17 days rads, than three cyber knife.  Seemed the cyber had the strongest affect though
Posts.Title: My mom's brain mets Cpratt2010 hezzy

Posts.Content: hezzy wrote: Hi Everyone, I have neuropathy in my feet.  I have the whole pins and needles affect.  When I run it feels like my feet have become flip flops.  Most of you would say not to run.  However, I have a three year old and that is IMPOSSIBLE.  I really dont mind the pain when I am playing with her cause I would rather be in pain playing than not playing at all. I had 2 rounds A/C , 6.2 rounds taxol/herceptin, and now abrexene/herceptin. A nurse told me that the neuropathy should fade over time but its getting worse. Has anyone had these side effects? What did you try? What did your ONC give you? Any advice would be great.  I have never went a summer without flip flops on.  Now im scared to take my sox off. thanx, heather heather j Dx 7/2/2007, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, 16/17 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: neuropathy??? hezzy Sierra

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2008 08:22PM hezzy wrote: thank you everyone so much, reading this makes me feel great !!!! and as far as getting out of anything or being asked for anything, i ask others for help collecting blankets, cloth, and food for those in need.....it doesnt have anything to do with cancer it doesnt make me specail it just puts smiles on someone face....most the time i wear my wig i dont want them knowing i have cancer because i dont want them thinking i have other things to worry about....i love what i do and who i am. i love cracking jokes with familly and friends that can handle it, im still trying to see if i can make it as mr. cleans wife yet or not LOL  thanks again hugs and love hezzy
Posts.Title: people keep asking hezzy nixieschaos

Posts.Content: hezzy wrote: I've actually lost count of how many treatments I have had.  Not that I have had as many as most, but I dont seem to care about the number anymore.  I have bone mets.  The last test showed it was no longer in scabula, but a small amount still in the veterbra.  I no longer have any pain, so I no longer take any pain medication.  I go in every three weeks for herceptin,abrexene, and zometa.  I get home and go about things like nothing happened. What is aggrivating me most is everytime I go in for a treatment or I see someone I get this.  Are you taking anti-depression, in group, getting support? Are you still taking pain meds?  I feel like I am doing fine.  I play with my three year old.  I cook dinner for my hubby.  Sometimes I actually forget I have cancer, no hair and have had a masc till someone says something.  However, it seems like when I tell someone Im doing good they get upset that Im not making a big deal or they think that I am in denial.  There are many nights I sit in worry, but I think its normal.  I dont think that I should have to worry each moment or that I need help.  My close family and friends call me an ispiration because I handle everything well.  How can I tell people that I appriciape their concern but to stop because it aggrivates me heather j Dx 7/2/2007, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, 16/17 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: dexa with tykerb marieibrahim marieibrahim

Posts.Content: hezzy wrote:      I found my balance to the most common side effects to tykerb.  Having to run to the bathroom every half hour after taking tykerb, or being backed up for days where I needed help using the restroom.  I asked my ONC if any other drugs where out there and she told my just to work a little harder on finding the balance.      Also, I take tykerb in a liq. form and not a pill.  Some aren't aware that you can take it to the pharmacy and ask for it to be turned into a liq ( i have phobia of swallowing medication )  I tried everything to take it and couldn't finally I found a pharmacy that was able to do it.  They had to get permission to do it on tykerb ( took two months to get permission ).      The amount I take daily is about three pills in a liq form.  I started taking diphen to control the side effects and it was almost six months before I found balance.      I'm not sure if this is 100% correct, however physically I think it is for me.  I take one less dose pill amount than the amount I get of the drug and it controls it.  Since tykerb is a take every 24hr drug(the way I take it)  I take my diphen in the morning once, than later in the afternoon again after taking my tykerb.  I have not had frequent bathroom visits or been backed up in a month and love it.  I am finally able to travel more than a half hour without the worry of a near by restroom for help.      I'm hardly in chat as much as I use to be and I so miss the people I love chatting with.  My next mission for myself is finding balance with neurapthy.  I'm no longer a good typer I dont think I could keep up again yet ... hugs heather j Dx 7/2/2007, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, 16/17 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: tykerb - diphen hezzy JeninMichigan

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2008 04:15PM hezzy wrote: Also, I take something called MI paste for my teeth.  After taking A/C and being sick for some time it seemed like it took its round on my teeth too.  Almost like they were well dry and dull.  I started using MI paste ( after ONC said alright ) and since than I have not had any problems.  Seems like the enanil is fine and everything is back to normal. heather-hezzy
Posts.Title: zometa and dental work everyminute everyminute

Posts.Content: hezzy wrote: Over the last few weeks I have worried myself sick. My hip started to bother me and I wondered if bone mets had spread there.  The ONC sent me in for a bone scan. Last weekend I noticed that my shoulder ( scabula bone w/ b-mets ) was bruised.  I called my ONC and hadnt heard back from him.  I had an appt Monday so I figured when I saw him Id give it to him for not calling me back and letting me worry all weekend. (( i had bruising once before there after taking asperin but hadn't had asperin or pain meds for some time and was over worried going nuts )) When I went in Monday I told him about my concerns and he didnt even seemed shocked.  He than told me that the bone scan showed nothing in the scabula bone or hip.  He said there was a very small amount shown in the lower vertebrae.    I started screaming, laughing, and crying I was so happy.  Although the bone mets are still showing in the lower back it was still a relief to hear they didnt see them anywhere else.   It was the first time since I was DX that I have recieved good news. I was scared I'd never see my three year old grow older, or my husband would disappear ( he's not her father but has been there since she was three months and done more than her father could imagine but the thoughts are there that if something went wrong my family would fall apart )) For over a year I have worried about what the future will hold and cried myself to sleep. For the first time in over a year.  I cried happy tears.  I will continue to pray and have hope.  Thank you for everyone that has helped me, listened, or prayed with me along the way. HUGS HEATHER- HEZZY heather j Dx 7/2/2007, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, 16/17 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Numbness in arm after SNB EClaire hezzy

Posts.Content: hezzy wrote: Im just starting to wonder if this fight is helping me or just tearing me up worse.  Im taking four steriods of Dex a day and they want me taking them six hours apart.  I started that and it was tearing me up not sleeping but a few hours every few days.  On top of this I started a new medication of Xeloda taking it twice a day 10=12 hours apart.  Along with daily Tykerb.  Im just having so much trouble finding any balance.  The Dex is suppose to have an affect on new fluid built up around the one of the brain tumors causing the fluid to move away.  The Xeloda and Tykerb are suppose to have an affect on the tumors.  Xeloda Im taking for fourteen days than seven days off, than Tykerb daily.  I think I could easily handle the Xeloda.  I'm loving that my feet feel warm because all other prior drugs caused neurapathy ect ect and I haven't gone for years without sox till recently.  I'm a little confused on why I actually feel backed because usually with Tykerb if Im taking taking diphen/atrop often Im in the bathroom all day but lately Ive needed meds just to go. IDK maybe Im just lost and not thinking I haven't slept well in days and Im so tired.  I just don't understand this Dex steriod and I'm praying it does something besides tear me apart. sorry ladies, im just ranting scared heather j Dx 7/2/2007, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, 16/17 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: PLEASE DESCRIBE WHAT YOUR PAIN FELT LIKE 1Cathi 1Cathi

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2008 02:14PM hezzy wrote:  I was told at 28yrs old I had bone mets, one month after the first dx of bc.  When I first heard I took it really good.  When I got home and looked into the eyes of my two year old daughter I lost it.  I cried for days everytime I looked at her.  I wondered if she would even remember me and know who I was.   After weeks of being down and trying my best not to let my daughter and husband see me that way I decided I had to do my best to fight this thing.    I started doing endless research and finding out so much more everyday.  I kept everything I learned in one journal ( now about three )    I started another journal soon after I heard I had bone mets.  I wrote everynight for months.  The hardest part was watching my daughter as I wrote her a letter.  Reading and Writing skills was my 101.  Each day that I wrote more and learned more I felt like I had a little bit more power.  I feel that the storm may never pass, so I either have to stay inside or dance in the rain.
